text: The CCTV New Year's Gala (Simplified Chinese: 中国中央电视台春节联欢晚会; Traditional Chinese: 中國中央電視台春節聯歡晚會; Pinyin: Zhōngguó zhōngyāng diànshìtái chūnjié liánhuān wǎnhuì) is a Chinese New Year special produced by China Central Television. It was presented by Zhao Zhongxiang. ==History== Since 1983, the variety program has been broadcast on the eve of Chinese New Year. "Spring Festival Gala goes through 3rd dress rehearsal," China Central Television. January 27, 2011; retrieved 2011-11-22. The show features various acts, including * Skits (小品) with a focus on comedy. * Xiangsheng (相声) or Stand-up comedy * Song and dance (歌舞) * Acrobatics (杂技) Across the span of years, viewers have had mixed reactions. "CCTV gala gets mixed reactions," China Daily (Xinhua). February 19, 2007; retrieved 2011-1122. According to the New York Times, "complaining about the show - with its blend of comedy, singing, dancing and propaganda - is as much a tradition as watching it."Yardley, Jim. "A TV 'King' Pushes the Limits, Flashily but Gently," New York Times. January 21, 2006; retrieved 2011-11-22. ===Guest appearances=== Performers who are famous in China are featured: * Jackie Chan (2005; 2009) * Dashan "Dashan to perform at Spring Festival Gala," China Central Television. January 29, 2011; retrieved 2011-11-22. * Zhang Ziyi (2000; 2001; 2008) ==References== == Other websites == *2007 CCTV New Year's Gala Category:Television Category:China Category:Television lists
